dcterms:description: The Wikipedia datasets comprise 5.9 (English) and 2.4 (German) million articles respectively that were directly retrieved from their rendered HTML pages. This corpus resolves Wikipedia’s templating syntax embedded in the dumps, representing the articles in their original form leading to improved data quality.
dcterms:title: Wikipedia

dcterms:creator: J. Achiam
S. Adler
S. Agarwal
L. Ahmad
I. Akkaya
F.L. Aleman
D. Almeida
J. Altenschmidt
S. Altman
S. Anadkat
dcterms:description: Bundesanzeiger contains 1.9 million German corporate annual reports from the Bundesanzeiger, a platform where German companies are mandated to publish their legally required documents. The average document length is roughly three times higher than Wikipedia articles, resulting in around 2,000 tokens per report.
dcterms:title: Bundesanzeiger

dcterms:description: The News dataset includes two proprietary datasets of English (2 million) and German (650 thousand) news articles, contributing to the total number of pre-training tokens.
dcterms:title: News

dcterms:creator: A. Cohan
I. Beltagy
D. King
B. Dalvi
D. Weld
dcterms:description: CSAbstruct dataset comprises 2,189 computer science abstracts with sentences annotated to discern their rhetorical roles.
dcterms:title: CSAbstruct

dcterms:creator: F. Dernoncourt
J.Y. Lee
dcterms:description: PubMed-RCT dataset extends evaluation to 20,000 biomedical abstracts from PubMed, segmented into five rhetorical categories.
dcterms:title: PubMed-RCT

dcterms:creator: S.N. Kim
D. Martinez
L. Cavedon
L. Yencken
dcterms:description: Nicta dataset includes 1,000 biomedical abstracts, where sentences are classified according to the PICO framework (Population, Intervention, Comparison, Outcome).
dcterms:title: Nicta

dcterms:description: IFRSEN dataset is composed of 45 English annual reports adhering to the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), containing annotations that map paragraphs to 543 distinct legal requirements.
dcterms:title: IFRSEN

dcterms:creator: L. Hillebrand
M. Pielka
D. Leonhard
T. Deußer
T. Dilmaghani
B. Kliem
R. Loitz
M. Morad
C. Temath
T. Bell
R. Stenzel
R. Sifa
dcterms:description: GRIDE dataset consists of 92 sustainability reports from leading German companies, annotated by experts to correspond with the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) standards, covering 89 indicators across economic, environmental, and social dimensions.
dcterms:title: GRIDE
